content.question: Boxes <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> of masses <math alttext="m sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="m sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="m sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively, are on a horizontal surface with negligible friction. A horizontal force <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is exerted on Box <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, as shown. The boxes remain in contact with each other as they move along the surface. The magnitude of the force that Box <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> exerts on Box <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> is

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator m sub C, and denominator m sub A, plus m sub B, end fraction, close parenthesis, times F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator m sub A, plus m sub B, and denominator m sub C, end fraction, close parenthesis, times F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mi>F</mi></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator m sub C, and denominator m sub A, plus m sub B, plus m sub C, end fraction, close parenthesis, times F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
